hook.text: A young professor cut open a human body in publicâ€”and proved the greatest doctor in history was wrong.

buildup.text: Andreas Vesalius performed human dissections at a time when anatomy was taught only from Galen's books.

discovery.text: He found over 200 errors in Galen's anatomy. The human body didn't match the textbook.

twist.text: The medical establishment attacked him. Some said the body had changed since Galen's time.

climax.text: His 1543 atlas, De Humani Corporis Fabrica, replaced dogma with direct observation forever.

punchline.text: Truth required cutting open both bodies and beliefs.

quiz.question: What did Vesalius discover by dissecting human bodies?
options: Over 200 errors in Galen's accepted anatomy
That Galen's anatomy was perfectly accurate
